Description: All HTML documents must start with a document type declaration.
The HTML document itself begins with <html> and ends with </html>.
This element is a container for metadata. HTML metadata is data about the HTML document. Metadata is not displayed.
The visible part of the HTML document is between <body> and </body>.
Defines the most important heading. <h6> defines the least important heading.

HTML paragraphs are defined with the

tag.
HTML links are defined with the <a> tag.
HTML images are defined with the tag. The source file (src)
column5: and height are provided as attributes.

Description: HTML buttons are defined with the <button> tag.
HTML lists are defined with the <ul> (unordered/bullet list) or the <ol> (ordered/numbered list) tag
Each list item starts with <li> tag.

is an empty element without a closing tag (the
tag defines a line break. Use
if you want a line break (a new line) without starting a new paragraph.
<hr> tag defines a thematic break in an HTML page
column3: and is most often displayed as a horizontal rule.

Description: The text inside a <pre> element is displayed in a fixed-width font (usually Courier)
column3: and it preserves both spaces and line breaks.

Description: <b> element defines bold text
<strong> element defines strong text
<i> element defines italic text
<em> element defines emphasized text
<small> element defines smaller text.
<mark> element defines marked/highlighted text.
<del> element defines deleted/removed text.
<ins> element defines inserted/added text.
<sub> element defines subscripted text.
<sup> element defines superscripted text.
<q> element defines a short quotation. Browsers usually insert quotation marks around the <q> element.
<abbr> element defines an abbreviation or an acronym.

<address> element defines contact information (author/owner) of a document or an article. <address> element is usually displayed in italic. Most browsers will add a line break before and after the element.
<cite> element defines the title of a work.Browsers usually display <cite> elements in italic.
<bdo> element defines bi-directional override. <bdo> element is used to override the current text direction.
Comment tags are used to insert comments in the HTML source code.
An internal CSS is defined in the <head> section of an HTML page
To use an external style sheet
column3: add a link to it in the <head> section of the HTML page.

Description: <map> tag defines an image-map. An image-map is an image with clickable areas.
<picture> element to add more flexibility when specifying image resources. The <picture> element contains a number of <source> elements
column3: each referring to different image sources. This way the browser can choose the image that best fits the current view and/or device.

Description: <source> element have attributes describing when their image is the most suitable.
An HTML table is defined with the <table> tag
Each table row is defined with the <tr> tag.
A table header is defined with the <th> tag.
A table data/cell is defined with the <td> tag.
An ordered list starts with the <ol> tag.
<dl> tag defines the description list.
<dt> tag defines the term (name).
<dd> tag describes each term.

Defines a section in a document(block-level).The <div> element is a block-level element.A block-level element always starts on a new line and takes up the full width available (stretches out to the left and right as far as it can).<div> element is often used as a container for other HTML elements.
Defines a section in a document (inline).An inline element does not start on a new line and only takes up as much width as necessary.
The <iframe> tag defines a rectangular region within the document in which the browser can display a separate document
column3: including scrollbars and borders. An inline frame is used to embed another document within the current HTML document.

Description: <script> tag is used to define a client-side script (JavaScript).<script> element either contains script statements
column3: or it points to an external script file through the src attribute.

Description: <noscript> tag is used to provide an alternate content for users that have disabled scripts in their browser or have a browser that doesn't support client-side scripts.
The <meta> element is used to specify which character set is used
column6: and other metadata. Metadata is used by browsers (how to display content)
